titles.title: Gädlä Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi "Vita of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi" / Täʾamrä Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi "Miracles of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi" / Mälkǝʾa Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi "Image of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi" / Gädlä Gäbrä Krǝstos "Vita of Gäbrä Krǝstos [St. Alexius]"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi "Vita of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi" (fols. 5ra-35rb l.9) II) Täʾamrä Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi "Miracles of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi" (fols. 35rb l.10-46vb) - Introductory homily (fols. 35rb l.10-36vb l.13) - 5 miracles (fols. 36vb l.14-46vb) III) Mälkǝʾa Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi "Image of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi" (fols. 47ra-50rb) IV) Gädlä Gäbrä Krǝstos "Vita of Gäbrä Krǝstos [St. Alexius]" (fols. 50ra-75vb)
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: According to Additio 1, ʾaläqa ʿAynä Kwǝllu Gäbrä Śǝllase (of Qäqäma?) sold the Ms. Probably he is also the scribe.

donors.donor: According to Additio 1, the Ms. was purchased by priest Dästa Kidanu (of?) Betä Ḥawaryat. Most probably he is also the donor.

dcomments.dcomment: According to Additio 1, the Ms. was purchased in 1941 A.D.

txstates.txstate: Holes and tears amended on fols. 26, 48, 64.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover, partly faded (at least 4 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, cross hatching, zig-zag).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – [፩]I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – ፪II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – ፫III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – ፭V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – ፯VII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 53r-60v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) –፱ IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – B(4/fols. 77r-80v)

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by very peculiar shapes of some letters, e.g., ላ and ካ have the left leg highly raised, the right one set on the ruling line.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra, names of the protagonists, a few other names (e.g., Mädḫane ʿAläm, Däbrä Dammo); a few lines on the incipit page of all texts, incipit of (sub)sections of Texts I, II and IV; Hebrew letters in Text IV (fol. 69va), world sälam "salutation" and its abbreviations in Text III; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (e.g., fols. 5vb, 12ra, 21vb, 34rb, 40rab, 50rb, 61va) ለ፡ ዓ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (e.g., fols. 19vb, 27vb, 30va, 31rb, 38rb, 46ra, 54vb) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (e.g., fol. 35rb) ለመ፡ ዓለ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (e.g., fol. 24vb) ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (fols. 47rb-50rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The explicit of Text I as presented in I. GUIDI, Il "Gadla ʼAragâwi", Roma 1895 (pp. 35-36 starting with the words: ተፈጸመ፡ ገድሉ፡ ወተኣምሪሁ፡ ለብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወብፁዕ፡ አቡነ፡ አረጋዊ...) is missing. For the collection of miracles of Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi see A. BRITA, I Racconti Tradizionali sulla "Seconda Cristianizzazione" dell'Etiopia, il Ciclo Agriografico dei Nove Santi, Napoli 2010, pp. 232-34. Text IV comprises the "List of Saints" (fols. 63ra l.2-64vb l.20), the "Song of Dawit" (fols. 64vb l.20-69va l.7) and the longer version of the kidan-scene (fol. 66ra l.22-69ra l.4).

additional.det: The note, dated to 10 Ṭǝqǝmt 1933 A.M. (= 17 June 1941 A.D.), mentions the seller ʾaläqa ʿAynä Kwǝllu Gäbrä Śǝllase (of Qäqäma?), the purchaser priest Dästa Kidanu (of?) Betä Ḥawaryat and the witnesses of the transaction. The Ms. was purchased for 28 Bǝrr. It is crudely written in Amharic. There are fingerprints at the end of the note.

extras.extra: - Lacunae left for rubricated names are not filled in all texts. - Crude drawings and doodles, in pen and pencil: fols. 1rv, 2rv, 44r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the upper margin: fols. 13r: ፪, 21r: ፫, 29r: ፬, 37r: ፭, 45r: ፮, 53r: ፯, 61r: ፰ and 69r: ፱.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin of some fols., in ink, felt pen and pencil: ዘወርኃ: ኅዳር: fol. 16r ዘወርኃ: ታኅሳስ: fol. 18r ዘጥር: fol. 19v ዘወርኃ: የካቲት: fol. 21r ዘመጋቢት: fol. 21v ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 24v ዘግንቦት: fol. 26r ዘሰኔ: fol. 27v ዘሐምሌ: fol. 30v ዘነሐሴ: fol. 31v ዘመስከረም: fol. 34r.

miniature.info: Fol. 4v: St. Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi, Archangel Michael and a snake (?).

drawing.info: Fol. 76r: St. Mary with the Child, two angels and three human figures.
drawing.details: Crude drawings in ink and felt pen (?).

frames.frame: - Fol. 5r (incipit page of Text I): coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 16r (incipit page of the readings for the month Ḫǝdar): coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 18r (incipit page of the readings for the month Taḫśaś): coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 21r (incipit page of the readings for the month Yäkkatit): coloured (red and black) ornamental band; floral motifs. - Fol. 24v (incipit page of the readings for the month Miyazya): coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 26r (incipit page of the readings for the month Gǝnbot): coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 47r (incipit page of Text III): coloured (red and black) ornamental band; floral motifs. - Fol. 50r (incipit page of Text IV): coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
